lccdd.comment: Tracker support and service materials for IB converted from the CAD drawings, see https://github.com/eic/epic/pull/803. This replaced part of the inner support cone (within first disk, and L3) in support_service_craterlake.xml (already modified accordingly).

define.comment: to avoid overlaps between simple geo shape boundaries e.g. when connecting box with ring
Radius: ring1 is the inner ring (L0), ring2 is the outer ring (L1). ring1_2 is the disk connecting ring1 and 2
all plates have same thickness and length
innner (smaller abs(z)) and outer endcap rings on negative and postive direction
L0 and L1 air tubes on the positive end (approx as disk), sheet 3
ring1 (smaller r) and 2. ring1_2 is the disk connecting two rings
L1PosCone
start the cone at r1 to avoid overlap with plate1_2midleft/right
L1NegCone
all plates have same thickness and length
endcap rings (2 each side, ring1 has smaller abs(z)) on negative and postive direction
ring1 (smaller r) and 2. ring1_2 is the disk connecting two rings
pos and neg legs, 8 each, leg 1-4 lower half, 4-8 upper

FPC from the silicon sensor, assume uniformly distributed cylinder. Each FPC layer (digi, analog, or signal) contains 70um thick of copper replace it with 100um of Aluminum. see https://github.com/eic/epic/pull/803
FPC cables along the cone on the Hadron (Pos) side
the cone holds cables from L0 and L1, assume uniformly spreaded along the cone, the average thickness is reduced due to cable fanning out.

detector.name: SVT_IB_Support_L2
detector.comment: -------------FPC connected to the sensors (see L1PosConeFPC for the cone), 9---------------

detector.name: SVT_IB_Support_L1
detector.comment: attach fanning out FPC cables to positive cone
cable connected to the silicon layer, approximated by ring
